Agency: Labor Department Wage and Hour Division
Info Source: March 7, 2017 download of a dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_summary.php
Notes: Date and year are the Findings End Date in the dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division, which does not provide case opening or closing dates. The company name is the Legal Name provided by the dataset unless that field is blank, in which case the Trade Name is used. The dataset provides only one address and does not indicate whether it is the company headquarters address or the establishment address. The penalty amount is the total of civil monetary penalties and mandated back wages. The original dataset provides a breakdown.

Private Litigation Case Title: Pyrka et al v. General Motors Corporation et al
Info Source: https://contractormisconduct.org/misconduct/461/in-re-general-motors-erisa-litigation

Description: General Motor's successor, the Motors Liquidation General Unsecured Creditors Trust, agreed to pay $875,000 in settlement of allegations of natural resource damage caused by GM at its former Framingham plant.
Info Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20120623210430/http://www.mass.gov/ago/news-and-updates/press-releases/2012/2012-05-03-gm-settlement.html

Description: General Motors agreed to pay $120 million to settle multistate allegations that the company concealed safety issues related to defective ignition switches in GM vehicles.
Info Source: https://www.oag.ca.gov/news/press-releases/attorney-general-becerra-announces-120m-multistate-settlement-general-motors

Description: General Motors agreed to settle allegations of air pollution violations at its Saginaw Metal Castings Operations with a $92,349 civil penalty, $113,000 for environmental projects, $65,000 for pollution control equipment, and the retirement of $185,000 of pollution credits the company held.
Info Source: https://wayback.archive-it.org/418/20070219002329/https://www.michigan.gov/ag/0,1607,7-164-34739_34811-101424--,00.html

Company: General Motors Corp. and Isuzu Motors Ltd.
Description: General Motors Corporation and Isuzu Motors Limited agreed to jointly pay $307,000 in settlement of alleged violations of the state's Clean Air Act by delivering trucks that were not certified under the Low Emission Vehicle Program.
Info Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20050214090602/http://www.ago.state.ma.us/sp.cfm?pageid=986&id=1367

Description: General Motors agreed to pay $2.845 million to resolve claims by 12 states concerning the recycling of mercury switches from vehicles going out of use.
Info Source: https://www.ri.gov/press/view/14131

Description: GM agreed to pay up to $6.28 million in restitution to customers and $1 million to the state relating to a series of recalls, including recalls related to faulty ignition switches that could switch off while consumers were driving.
Info Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20180924233724/https://www.azag.gov/press-release/ag-brnovich-obtains-628-million-arizonans-who-purchased-recalled-gm-vehicles

Description: General Motors agreed to pay $13.9 million to settle a lawsuit brought by the Orange County District Attorney's Office alleging that the company concealed serious safety defects to avoid costly recalls and part replacements.
Info Source: https://www.ocregister.com/2017/10/27/general-motors-settles-with-oc-district-attorney-for-13-9-million-in-lawsuit-over-alleged-concealment-of-defects/

Description: The California Attorney General announced a $5.75 million settlement with General Motors , resolving allegations that GM made false and misleading statements to investors, including the state's largest pension system, regarding the costs the company would incur due to its ignition switch problems.
Info Source: https://www.oag.ca.gov/news/press-releases/attorney-general-becerra-announces-575-million-settlement-general-motors-0
